hackathon-description-text: Held on the beautiful campus of Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University in bright and sunny Daytona Beach, Florida, this hackathon is guaranteed to be a unique experience for all attendees. Our event partners represent big players in the aviation and aerospace industry, not to mention all kinds of software startups from Florida's rapidly growing Space Coast economy. HackRiddle just so happens to be an MLH Member Event, which entitles you to a whole host of perks and benefits just for showing up. Learn more here:

hackathon-judges.judge-role: STEM Specialist at Volusia County Schools
Principal Technical Director at Virtual Heroes, a Division of Applied Research Associates
PhD Student / Instructor for EGR101 at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University
Software Engineer at Boeing, Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University Alumbus
IT Security Services, Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University
Sr. Software Engineer at Rockwell Collins

hackathon-rules: We will be using the MLH Code of Conduct.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First choice of a prize from our event prize pool, which includes Snapchat Spectacles, Das Keyboards, and more!
Second choice of a prize from our event prize pool, which includes Snapchat Spectacles, Das Keyboards, and more!
Third choice of a prize from our event prize pool, which includes Snapchat Spectacles, Das Keyboards, and more!
The award for the project that best represents innovation in the field of aviation and aerospace. Winner of this category will receive a Wi-Fi enabled FPV drone.
This is the project that is selected as most innovative by representatives of Rockwell-Collins.
This is the prize awarded to the best project submitted by a team of first-time hackers.
The award for the project selected by the judges as the best project utilizing hardware at a meaningful level. Winners will receive a hardware kit!

Provided by ERAU IT Security Services, this is the award for the project selected by the judges as the best project that promotes or supports information security practices in academic, professional, or personal life. Winners will receive an Amazon Echo (2017)!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Willie Miller Instructional Center, 600 S Clyde Morris Blvd, Daytona Beach, FL 32114, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Projects will be judged based on a variety of factors. This might include the technical complexity of your project, the depth of your idea, and more.

hackathon-location-address: Willie Miller Instructional Center, 600 S Clyde Morris Blvd, Daytona Beach, FL 32114, USA
hackathon-description-header: HackRiddle is Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University's premier collegiate hackathon held in Daytona Beach, FL.
